pyenigma_api.plugboard.PlugBoard¶

class pyenigma_api.plugboard.PlugBoard¶

Class that implements the plugboard

Plugboard switches one character to the other depending upon whether there is a shorting cable(short) present between the two characters. A short maps one character to the other and vice versa. Eg: A short between ‘a’(1) and ‘x’(24) will make an input of ‘x’(24) to ‘a’(1) and an input of ‘a’(1) to ‘x’(24). There cannot be more than one shorts to or from any one of the characters as that would lead to non-determinism of the output.

shorts_dict¶

Dictionary of all the short present in the plugboard For every short there are two key value pairs present in the plugboard

Type:

dict

shorts¶

List of all the shorts in the plugboard as two element sets

Type:

dict

__init__()¶

Initialize the plugboard with new shorts

Methods

__init__()

Initialize the plugboard with new shorts

add_short(short)

Add the provided short to the plugboard

get_all_shorts()

get_output(input_int)

Get a output from the switchboad according to the shorts present

remove_short(short_tuple)

Remove the provided short from the plugboard
